titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Unitarian Universalist Women's Heritage Society Records
Unitarian Universalist Women's Heritage Society Records
titlestmt.author: Divinity Library staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday March 26, 2019 at 22:16

did.unittitle: Unitarian Universalist Women's Heritage Society Records
did.abstract: This collection contains biographical and historical information about Unitarian Universalist women and churches.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three series: I. Subject File, II. Oral History Transcripts, III. Pamphlets and Books.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Unitarian Universalist Women's Heritage Society (UUHW) and the Unitarian Universalist Historical Society (UUHS) joined to form the Unitarian Universalist History and Heritage Society (UUHHS) in July 2011.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: From the Andover Newton Theological School Collection, transferred to the Yale Divinity School Library in 2017.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Unitarian Universalist Women's Heritage Society Records (RG 301), Special Collections, Yale Divinity School Library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains a subject file of biographical and historical material related to various individuals and topics as well as oral history transcripts and publications documenting the work of Unitarian Universalists, particularly women.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "An appeal in favor of that class of Americans called Africans"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The original finding aid has an entry for "Occasional Papers" and the note that "All are in online catalog and shelved with the pamphlet collection."
